title: How to find the x-coordinate of each point where the tangent line of $2y (3 - x) = x^4$ is vertical (calculus, derivatives, solution verification, implicit differentiation, tangent line, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: 2y (3 - x) = x⁴ Differentiating implicitly: 2y(-1)dx + 2(3-x)dy = 4x³dx Dividing by 2: -ydx + (3-x)dy = 2x³dx Rearranging: (3-x)dy = (2x³+y)dx So dx/dy = (3-x)/(2x³+y) For tangent line to be vertical, dx/dy=0, so (3-x)/(2x³+y)=0, so 3-x=0, so x=3
